title: news.com.au — Australia’s #1 news site
text: Deputy Prime Minister Michael McCormack says “we want to build dams, we are building dams, and we’re getting on with the job,” Mr McCormack's guarantee comes after it was announced the federal government and New South Wales government would split the cost of a new dam to be builtt in Dungowan near Tamworth. Mr McCormack told Sky News funding for the new dam would be a “$484 million build extending the water capacity there by 22.5 gigalitres”. “We’re raising Wyangala dam’s wall by ten metres and that’s going to increase storage capacity by 650 gigalitres, more than a Sydney harbour capacity,” he said. The Deputy Prime Minister said the builds would be "great for farmers, flood mitigation and helping to further drought-proof the west and the northwest of New South Wales”. Image: News Corp Australia
